column5: 사람들은 원한다 / 지도자를 따르는 것을 (긍정적인 감정 상태를 지닌).

column5: 더 행복한 삶을 위해서, / 그만두어라 / 다른 이들의 기대에 따라 사는 것을.

column6: {{c1::Be certain of your decision regardless of whether it is small or significant.}}
column7: be certain of / your decision / regardless of / whether / it / is / small or significant

column5: 반복적인 스케줄은 / 우리에게 안정감을 준다, // 우리가 안다는 점에서 / 다음에 무엇이 올지.
column6: {{c1::A repetitive schedule gives us a sense of security, in that we know what is coming next.}}
column7: a repetitive schedule / gives / us / a sense of security / in that / we / know / what is coming next

column5: 음식은 정말 훌륭했다, / 우리가 한 시간 동안 기다려야 했다는 것 외에는.
column6: {{c1::The food was awesome, except that we had to wait for an hour.}}
column7: the food / was / awesome / except / that / we / had to / wait / for an hour

column5: 교육은 (~을) 가능하게 한다 / 모든 장벽을 부수는 것을.
column6: {{c1::Education makes it possible to defeat all barriers.}}
column7: education / makes / it / possible / to defeat / all barriers

column5: 그 연구는 (~을) 분명하게 했다 // 충분한 수면이 중요하다는 것을 / 건강에.
column6: {{c1::The research made it evident that good sleep is key to good health.}}
column7: the research / made / it / evident / that / good sleep / is / key to good health

column5: 나는 (~이) 어렵다는 것을 알았다 / 두 시간 만에 그 일을 끝내는 것이.
column6: {{c1::I found it difficult to finish the task in two hours.}}
column7: I / found / it / difficult / to finish / the task / in two hours

column5: 교육자들은 (~이) 현명하다고 믿는다 / 자기 주도 학습을 강조하는 것이.
column6: {{c1::Educators believe it wise to emphasize self-directed learning.}}
column7: educators / believe / it / wise / to emphasize / self-directed learning

column5: 당신은 (~을) 명심해야 한다 // 시간은 아무도 기다려주지 않는다는 것을.
column6: {{c1::You should keep it in mind that time waits for no one.}}
column7: you / should / keep / it / in mind / that / time / waits for / no one

column5: 나는 (~을) 규칙으로 하고 있다 / 그날의 일을 계획하는 것을 / 아침에.
column6: {{c1::I make it a rule to plan for each day’s work in the morning.}}
column7: I / make / it / a rule / to plan / for each day’s work / in the morning

column5: 나는 (~을) 당연하게 여긴다 // 기회가 언제나 계속되는 것은 아니라는 것을.
column6: {{c1::I take it for granted that opportunities don’t always last.}}
column7: I / take / it / for granted / that / opportunities / don’t always last

column5: 정부는 (~을) 어려워하고 있다 / 증가하는 노인 인구를 돌보는 것을.
column6: {{c1::Governments are finding it hard to look after the increasing number of old people.}}
column7: governments / are finding / it / hard / to look after / the increasing number of old people

column5: 의사들은 (~을) 중요하다고 생각한다 / 유아들을 보호하는 것을 / 보조비타민을 제공함으로써.
column6: {{c1::Doctors consider it important to safeguard infants by giving supplementary vitamins.}}
column7: doctors / consider / it / important / to safeguard / infants / by giving / supplementary vitamins
